content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 4 in the given graph is:

6 -> 7 -> 4

This path has length 2 and is the shortest route possible using the given edges and starting node. Note that this path excludes node 6 as the starting point, which is why it does not appear in the path. If you change the endpoint to node 7, the new shortest path will be the original shortest path minus the last point, which in this case is node 4.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 7 in the given graph is:

6 -> 7

This path has length 1 and is the shortest route possible using the given edges and starting node. Note that this path excludes node 6 as the destination, which is why it does not appear in the path. If you change the endpoint to node 7, the new shortest path will be the original shortest path minus the starting point, which in this case is node 6.
